sec.p: Significant fluctuations occur between freshwater and marine diatoms in this subzone. Marine and brackish-water taxa continue to increase in abundance and species diversity, together reaching >60%. Freshwater, halophilous species also increase in importance, especially Cocconeis pediculus Ehr. and Nitzschia tryblionella Hantzsch. Freshwater taxa (oligohalobous–indifferent) generally represent <35% of the total assemblage. Fragilaria spp. fall through ldaz CGD2a to low values in ldaz CGD2b (<3%). A. granulata declines to 10–15% and is joined at similar values by Epithemia turgida (Ehr.) Kütz, accompanied by lower frequencies of Stephanodiscus astraea (Ehr.) Grun.
